website_summaries.verdict: The Toshiba HD-A20 is a perfectly competent HD DVD player, but it's not worth the extra money when compared to the budget Toshiba HD-A2.
pros: Excellent image quality on HD DVD in 1080i mode
good upscaling performance on film-based DVDs
Ethernet jack included for firmware upgrades
much faster load times than its predecessor
cons: Somewhat disappointing picture quality in 1080p mode
ongoing format war means many films won't be available on HD DVD

customer_reviews.title: Great HD-DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: This player is great. I've got it connected to a Dell 37" LCD via a cheap HDMI cable and the picture is VERY crisp (no need to spend tons of money on monster cables). I can't say that it does much to existing DVD's regarding the up convert though. When turning the player on, it's a little slow to boot up to open the door. I've got it connected to my network and did all of the updates for it over the internet instead of having to order a cd from Toshiba...great thinking Toshiba. I would definitely recommend this player. This player has exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Great Player for my Vizio 37" HDTV!
customer_reviews.text: It took about 3mins to hook this player up to one of the HDMI ports on my VIZIO 37" HDTV. I picked up the $11.99 HDMI cable from 'cables to go' here on amazon and VOILA! Perfect HD-DVD right out of the box and in minutes! Although I did hit up the Toshiba website, download the latest firmware, burn to CD and install that...didn't take long (no where near the 30mins it says it takes) and now it's running perfect. Buy it..it's the best deal out there! I know, I've researched for months before pulling the trigger last week on this!
customer_reviews.author: D. McCabe

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba HD-A2
customer_reviews.text: My plan was to hold off to see who won the HD / Blue Ray format war until I saw the HD-A2. For a few hundred bucks I could afford to be on the loosing end of the format war (which may drag on for years) and enjoy HD in the meantime. I purchased the Planet series with the player and have been truly impressed. As I say posted with some of the reviews, the player takes awhile to turn on, read a disc and start playing (a good 2-3 minutes). But if you can get past that the player is inexpensive and produces.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great, low-cost HD-DVD player
customer_reviews.text: This item has been replaced by the HD-A3, but has nearly identical specs. Pros: Cheap, great image quality, ethernet connection for downloading firmware upgrades and for online content, HDMI output, upscales your old dvd's. Cons: Not 1080p (1080i), slow to boot up. Got this and the Samsung 1400 Blu-Ray player for around $525 combined. A great way to be format-neutral for high definition dvds. My friend got the 1080p version (for $300 more), and I can't tell the difference, although he swears he can. Looks great on my Pioneer plasma, especially with "Planet Earth".
customer_reviews.author: Dr. M. Ghotbi

customer_reviews.title: Slow but worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this Toshiba DVD player. WOW!!! what can I say the video is exceptional. The price was great. The free DVD's help to sweet'n the deal. There is nothing bad to say about this well made product except the lethargic response. It takes a while to come to life and then more time to accept the DVD. It's also slow turning off. With that said I still give it a 5!!! This is a must have if you want to jump into the HD DVD realm with taking out a loan. I play all of my DVD's and limited HD DVD's on it and I'm hooked.
customer_reviews.author: Jam'N

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba always a great buy.....
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Toshiba DVD player that I have owned. The first one lasted about 7-8 years and always performed well. This new model seems even better than the last one and I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for simplicity in set-up and a quality product. I am not one who uses many of the features available on the DVD remote controller; however, this one is pretty much the same format as the previous and easy to use. Overall, Toshiba provides a good product and I have no complaints, so far.....
customer_reviews.author: jws in ack

customer_reviews.title: Best DVD player I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have had the HD-A2 for almost a year, and the experience has been nothing but pleasant. It has been as reliable as can be, and gets better with every firmware release. Mine started off with 1.something. I have run every update over the included ethernet jack (internet) with no problems. It has played every disc I've thrown at it, without a single hiccup, HD-DVD and SD-DVD. I've been so happy with HD-DVD that I decided to step up to the next model and just ordered the HD-A35.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Nolen

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: At this point in the game I could care less which is better...BD or HD. All I can tell you is the Toshiba A2 is amazing for the price. The picture quality is ridiculous...I just watched 300 nad am blown away. I watched The Matrix in HD and the upscaled version and although the HD version is better, the unit does a great job on upscaling the SD version. The only reason I bought an HD DVD player is because it was $300 less than the cheapest BD unit. Money is Money.
customer_reviews.author: Deidraaa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality player and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Before I connect this toshiba player to my projector Hitachi PJ-TX100 via HDMI-to-DVI cable, I download the latest firmware. The result is awesome. I expect to get 1080i, but somehow it shows 720p. I called the customer supports. Toshiba support said my Hitachi projector did not support 1080i. The Hitachi support insisted the projector support 1080i and it was the fault of Toshiba player. I'm confused but I am not worried. In 720p, the picture is much better than regular DVD in approximately 80-in size projector. It also upconvert DVD resolution better that my DVD player (also from Toshiba). Beware though, HD-A2 can not read DVD+ format.
customer_reviews.author: Pikmin

customer_reviews.title: works GREAT !!
customer_reviews.text: Just a quick note to say that it works perfect out of box. no issues at all. Great , stunning picture. 5 free dvd offer came without a hitch. I would recommend it to anyone on a lower budget for hd player. Just gotta hope I did not pick the "beta" hd version this time.. update : 2-21-08 I did get a beta...rats! wait to buy blue ray as ver 2.0 is due soon. 1.x is not upgradeable ...beware!
customer_reviews.author: tavegas

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Besides the outstanding picture quality it has one feature that I love, when paused it shows a progress bar a the bottom of the screen with the elapsed played time and the total movie time and also graphically see at a glance how far into the movie you are. Cons: Must use HDMI to get full 1080i upconversion. This really isn't a CON since I'm using HDMI. Slow startup, but this is a known issue. Both Blue-Ray and HD are slow to release movies and have a limited selection. I wish there were more movies available, but this really isn't a con of the player.
customer_reviews.author: technoshopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice player for money
customer_reviews.text: Nice player for the money. Great quality output is possible with good source material. The ethernet port is a great idea and an easy way to upgrade the firmware using an Internet connection. I would have given this player five stars but it lacked some features and options that my last non-HD DVD had. It's also a bit slow to startup. 1080i should be fine for most people. Depending on the equipment (TV), the difference between 1080i and 1080p is probably nothing as long as you have a decent TV with correct video processing.
customer_reviews.author: Lantana Al

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba's HD-DVD A2 just gets better...
customer_reviews.text: As a previous owner of the HD-DVD A1 player, the A2 is a step in the right direction. From the onset, the player provided some of the best upscale standard definition DVD playback as well as excellent feature ritch HD-DVD playback. The load times of DVD discs is quite respectable from the previous generation player, thought not quite as fast as the traditional DVD players. Understanding the complexity of the content now being played back helps to understand why the delay, and the excellent picture quality over HDMI makes one forget all about the slow load times. All in all, the player was excellent and purchasing it through one of Amazon.com's supplier was the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful picture!
customer_reviews.text: This deck was very easy to install and operate. Looks nice and the picture is stunning. The setup menus are easy to follow and I was able to update the firmware by downloading and burning to a CD-R. The instructions from Toshiba were very clear and easy to follow for this process. So far the only issue I've had is trying to find the Mfg device code so I can program the operations into my cable remote but I doubt that will be hard to find (hopefully). Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jakester

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HD DVD PLAYER at a very low price
customer_reviews.text: One of the best dvd players I have ever purchased. The quality is awesome on my Samsung plasma TV. Highly recomended. And at the price, its a steal compared to over priced blu-ray, plus you get 5 free HD DVDs with the purchase of this product. You can't go wrong. I only have one little complaint about this dvd player, it doesn't play VCDs. But other than that its a great DVD player, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Salem

customer_reviews.title: Great Player
customer_reviews.text: Only possible drawback: startup time is a little slow, I usually start powering it on by pressing the eject button, then turn on and setup the rest of my home theater setup and by the time everything is setup the tray is out and ready. Quality is beautiful in HD and upconverted DVDs, sound is great, no complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: MacAddictG4

customer_reviews.title: finally, an HD player everyone can afford.
customer_reviews.text: this player has been flawless for us.....it is fast, produces a beautiful picture and plays everything we put into it......sound is great as well....we have it running into a creative DDTS-100 into the big logitechs........as a matter of fact, it is better at upconversion for regular DVDs than the Oppo players (Oppos are very complex to set up)and yes, of course we tried both Oppos........last but not least, the price was right.........after applying for the Amazon credit card & having a coupon from the reseller with that discount as well, we paid 306.00 shipped........fabulous, Amazon, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Ajax

customer_reviews.title: Love this HD DVD player!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the first generation Toshiba player which couldn't play a single movie without freezing up (which I returned for a refund), this player has been flawless so far (~2 months). The only drawbacks I've found are: (i) you sometimes have to hit the eject button several times before the tray will open; (ii) the upscaled signal is output ONLY via HDMI (since I can only use component output I can't take advantage of this otherwise great feature); and (iii) neither 5.1 nor coaxial audio outputs are provided, so HDMI is the only way to get the full benefit of this player's audio capabilities. Sounds great via optical anyway, though.
customer_reviews.author: Just My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Player
customer_reviews.text: I have had this player for several months now and it has definitely been worth a positive experience. I would recommend anyone looking for a good upconverting DVD player to buy the newer Tochiba HD-A3 player as it is now comparable in price to some of the better upconverting standard DVD players out there and provides you with the added option of able play HD-DVDs.
customer_reviews.author: YarDost

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: pros: 1) Awesome upscaling, standard definition DVD's look amazing. Most players lose points here, and I think is the biggest differentiating factor. 2) HD DVD's of course look awesome as everyone says. cons: boot up time, but not a biggie.
customer_reviews.author: crew cut

customer_reviews.title: Great HDDVD & DVD Payer
customer_reviews.text: Great 1080i HDDVD player and the DVD up-scaling is terrific also. It is a little slow to powerup and start the HDDVD, but once the HDDVD is loaded the menu controls work just fine. For the price you just can't beat it. Since the HD-A2 player was so inexpensive and my 50inch plasma only handles 1080i there was no reason for me to bother looking at more expensive 1080p players. I figure when I upgrade to a HDTV that handles 1080p then I'll upgrade my player.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan N Austin

customer_reviews.title: Impressive video and audio
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed by the video quality when using HD-DVDs and SD-DVDs. Loading time of the DVDs was a little slower than a normal DVD player but it wasn't too bad. I used HDMI cable for the video and optical cable for audio. The audio quality was also impressive. I could hear the sound of the bug-container dropping on the asphalt road when Trinity throws it out of the car after taking it out of Neo's stomach in the Matrix. The price of the system was also affordable. My only regret was that the system could not play CDRs, CD-RWs with mp3.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sahoo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Player, but weak HDMI output
customer_reviews.text: Except for a minor problem, I'd rate the HD-A2 a 5. When I bought this player, I'd intended to feed the HDMI output to my Sony HD TV by way of an HDMI switch box along with my HD TiVo. Unfortunately, I'd lose sound and picture after a few minutes. There was no problem when connecting the player directly to the HDMI input on the TV. Toshiba has acknowledged that there is a problem with HDMI output, and has issued several firmware updates to address it.
customer_reviews.author: Cholly

customer_reviews.title: Great Value / Mac Users Take Note Re Firmware Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: At $230-$240 plus 5 HD DVD's from Toshiba, this HD DVD player costs about the same or less than a very good, regular DVD player with upscaling capability. Picture is outstanding though don't expect a significant difference as compared to HD programming you are already viewing via HD cable (e.g., Planet Earth series). Regular DVD's are upscaled to near HD quality. N.B. Mac users - if you elect to download the firmware update (the easiest & quickest way to upgrade), you must use "Disk Utility" (not "Finder") to copy the HD-A2-2200U.iso file to a CD (Firmware upgrade may not work copied to a DVD).
customer_reviews.author: Kevinr1

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: Overall this HD DVD Player is awesome great looking picture sound is amazing. Make sure you updated before you play it. Only negatives i can find are yes it does load a bit long when you first start it and a couple of times i have had to load a disc and it not display to turn it off and try again and then it will display. Heroes looks awesome :0 cant wait for Transformers.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Fortell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Fulfills my expectations of a modestly priced HD DVD player. When used with an HD DVD the pictures are crisp and clear. Even "regular" DVD's showed a significant improvement in sharpness and clarity of pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Max S. Teng

customer_reviews.title: Excellent HD DVD/DVD player
customer_reviews.text: This player is a great value. For about 200 bucks, you get great upconversion of your existing DVDs and excellent high definition playback of the newer HD DVD discs. Once you watch high def discs, you can't go back. Toshiba should have included an HDMI cable, though. However, these can be purchased on-line for $10 (DON'T get suckered into paying a hundred dollars for one of these cables!) so it's not a huge deal. Add to that 5 free HD DVDs from Toshiba, and you can't lose.
customer_reviews.author: S. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great HD Picture
customer_reviews.text: HD is the way to go low cost and free HD dvd`s on this purchase. Why pay 400.00 for Blueray ? Not everyone wants a game console. Sharp picture with HD DVD and Regular DVD . A little slow loading first DVD on start up , second DVD OK Only had for 1 mth hope it lasts many years. Easy hookup to HD TV HDMI .
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J. Hiller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a good player until they stopped making the dvds, then all I needed was my play station
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba HD-A2 HD DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: The original unit sent to me did not work from day 1. Was very, very unhappy with it. However, because Amazon was so understanding and without hesitation sent me a new unit which works just fine, I rated the unit a 4. The HD-DVD player was very easy to set up and after seeing approx. 5 movies, it has been working with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST UPSCALING DVD PLAYER AVAILABLE
customer_reviews.text: I have had my HD-A2 unit since Dec. 06 and I couldn't be more happy with it. The best thing about the unit is that it has made most of my existing DVD's look as though they are really HD DVD's. I'd say about 75% of my DVD's look fabulous when I play them on this unit. The other 25% just look a little clearer than when they are played on a standard DVD player. I highly recommend this unit. If you want to get an HD quality picture from your existing DVD's this would be the unit for you.
customer_reviews.author: JHB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome HD DVD Player!
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around for awhile and decided on this HD-A2 and I'm glad I did! I read the many great reviews and dived right in with Amazon's great price. The image quality with my Samsung LNT4661F LCD 1080p truly delivers sharp and crisp resolution. Sure, slow start up, but, whatever...it doesn't bother me. The results are amazing. I currently have the 2.1 firmware upgrade. Make yourself happy and get this HD DVD player! Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: R. Bach

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit and Seller!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome unit that we are enjoying very much! HD DVD is almost like 3D in some movie scenes. Seller was great, unit in tip top condition and arrived more quickly than I expected. Would gladly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: BobCat

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba HD-DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: This HD DVD player was a snap to install and works flawlessly. It's questionable whether or not the HD format will prevail or if BluRay will replace it, but I, like many others, am watching my pennies and will opt for the HD DVDs rather than BluRay based on the price difference. The Toshiba HD DVD player was also easily recognized by my Harmony Universal Remote, so I can control the TV, Home Theater, DVD, and Satellite DVR with a single remote.
customer_reviews.author: WVoldies

customer_reviews.title: Planing on going HD? Go Toshiba
customer_reviews.text: I must say i was a little overwhelmed by all the fuzz regarding BD vs HD-DVD, until i was able to compare the image quality from both, toshiba did an incredible job with HD-DVD, easy to use, user friendly and of course the looks aren't bad either. I trully recommend this player to everybody, buy it from Amazon also, the price is a lot cheaper from you average store!
customer_reviews.author: Esteban Morales

customer_reviews.title: affordable hd
customer_reviews.text: The player works great better than just hd movies it makes regular dvds better I guess through the hdmi or whatever, they just look great. Affordable and easy to set up. I updated software, even though I didn't think the loading time was long at all. Anyways, will probably be buying another one for my family room soon!
customer_reviews.author: Robot1234

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: Playback issues with certain disks. Firmware update does not fix the problem it still shows the dreaded "408bc504" error code
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Seems fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my folks so they could watch the HD version of Planet Earth and it seems to work fine. My only complaint is that Toshiba doesn't provide and HDMI cable with the unit. The cable they provide doesn't do justice to HD. So if you buy this product, be sure to also order an HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.author: JoshInMillValley

customer_reviews.title: It works Great with my 50" Plasma HDTV
customer_reviews.text: The HD-A2 HD DVD worked the first time I set it up. It only took about 5 minutes. The startup is slow. The clarity is better than DVD, but not way too much. It is noticeable. I wish they offered more HD-DVD selections. Overall, I'm very happy and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: R. Aldana

customer_reviews.title: Don't be concerned with boot-up time.
customer_reviews.text: First let me address the slow starting. This HD DVD player is not like your usual standard definition player. It actually is like a computer, with RAM and a hard drive. My suggestion is turn on your player, get everything else ready to go and, no problems. We are only talking about 30 seconds or so. It is no big deal. Enjoy! I am.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin S.

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfid with this HDDVD player
customer_reviews.text: I have been very satisfied with this HDDVD player. The picture is amazing, as well is the sound on my 6.1 setup. The build quality of the unit is solid and the aesthetics are beautiful. The player is reliable, and does a wonderful job playing your old SDDVD's and an outstanding jon playing HDDVD's (just make sure your firmware is updated). I would defiantly recommend this player. The only thing that bothers me is the startup time. But down the line i bet its something that can be fixed with a firmware update. You will not be disappointed !
customer_reviews.author: N. Cayre

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before i pulled the trigger on this player. The most common problem had with it was its load up time, but honestly its only a couple seconds longer than a regular DVD player. The picture is amazing and the sound quality makes me feel as if I have a brand new stereo system. I can honestly say I have no buyers remorse and have recommended this player to all of my friends and family alike.
customer_reviews.author: Tim1977

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable resolution for less than $400
customer_reviews.text: I got the unit after reading all the reviews, yup!...it takes a while to load, but it's all worth it when you see the resolution! My plasma has 2 hdmi input and I was able to compare the same brand Toshiba "regular" upscaling-to-1080i" unit with this HD player....boy I tell you what a difference! This thing is the closest that you can get to a poor man's Blu Ray unit.
customer_reviews.author: Scorpion Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I have been debating on getting an HD DVD player for a few months now. I did all my research and decided to get the Toshiba HD-A2. I just got this bad boy in the mail today. I just hooked it up and watched "The Departed". The picture and sound are AMAZING! I can't wait to add more HD DVDs to my collection. If you are looking for an awesome HD DVD player that preforms to a "T", then this is the right choice for you!
customer_reviews.author: J. Bess

customer_reviews.title: I expected better
customer_reviews.text: This player has a lot of options; it can connect directly to the internet via ethernet. Unfortunately, it takes about a full minute (or longer) for the HDVD to turn on and open. You have to download the updates via ethernet or onto a DVD, or else you'll have problems (mine was with the sound.) I've had my player for about 2 weeks and it already needs an update. If you don't have internet access or a DVD burner, you can call support and have them mail the updates.
customer_reviews.author: sdk1122

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba does it again!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased the HD-A2, I found this product incredible!!! I have an HP DLP that displays 720p and the dvd does an incredible job!!! If you have a regular dvd player and an hdtv you really do not know what you are missing . If you can afford it, please upgrade you will not be disappointed!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Albert Clark Jr.

customer_reviews.title: excellent player
customer_reviews.text: purchased this player from amazon a few weeks ago and i love it. i won't be long winded but WOW! great picture, great sound (and that's just with an optical connection to my receiver, once i upgrade to an HDMI equipped receiver the neighbors will probably be calling the cops). Excellent upconversion quality as well. All for a great price. I highly recommend this player.
customer_reviews.author: John Cocktosen

customer_reviews.title: Great hddvd player overall
customer_reviews.text: The startup time for this player is still too long, even though it's faster than the old version. If you have a disc in the drive, and turn the player on solely for the purpose of removing the disc, you have to wait at least a full minute. It's very frustrating. Otherwise, the video quality is superb. Even non-hd dvd's look better.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCommander

customer_reviews.title: Just waht the doctor ordered
customer_reviews.text: The Tobshiba HD-2A HD DVD player is the best we have bought in years. Wish we would have bought this HD player a lot sooner, its well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect...
customer_reviews.text: The HD-DVD videos are amazing. My only gripes about this machine is the super slow startup times. Even my windows desktop loads faster than this box! Plus, it has been about 2 months and I haven't received my free HD-DVDs yet either. The same goes for the PS3 free bluray DVDs.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Dude

customer_reviews.title: HD-A2 review.  Great HD-DVD player.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player from Amazon earlier this month. I found the quality to be great with the HD Movies and very good with SD DVDs I've watched. I have a 37" 720p LCD tv from Vizio and the HD-A2 sends a 1080i signal to it. I upgraded the firmware to version 2.5 right away. It came with version 1.2 from the factory. I like the ethernet port for HD-DVD web-enabled features and firmware upgrades.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto A. Urena

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Very good picture and audio quality. More importantly it is best player considering price.
customer_reviews.author: Taeseung Yoo

customer_reviews.title: Good player for first generation
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great. The movies are crystal clear. Very easy to use. One drawback is the amount of time it takes to load a disc. The player will take several seconds until it recognizes the disc and starts to play it
customer_reviews.author: Peter Schwager

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used both Blu-ray and HD DVD and to me, there's no comparison. HD DVD looks and sounds better. Don't be fooled by Sony's hype about having a larger storage. HD DVD has plenty of room to store over 4 hours of high definition on one side of one disc. Also, HD DVD uses a superior codec than Blu-ray and has internet access on every player for firmware updates to make your player run better and add features. Trust me, HD DVD all the way!!
customer_reviews.author: Gadgetguy

customer_reviews.title: Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: The Player was exactly as described and is working fine. And it arrived very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jana A.

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba HD DVD
customer_reviews.text: Great DVD player. My only complaint is that loading a DVD is slow.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon Cornwell

customer_reviews.title: great for HOME HD-DVDs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine for my dad so I can make home HD-DVD movies from my Canon HV20 using ordinary DVD4 and DVD9s to send to him. Works great and cheap! Don't expect it to be nearly as easy (if at all possible) with Blue-ray.
customer_reviews.author: VDT

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant HD Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a couple weeks back and am absolutely thrilled with the performance...this is the most affordable HD Disc option on the market and the results are quite stunning! Upconversion of standard def DVDs is excellent too...all around fantastic players. If you've been thinking about Hi-Def options at a budget price there is nothing that can beat this beauty!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P. Nkolola

customer_reviews.title: the best of the best!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this player and wow it holds its own against my ps3 blu-ray player!this whole format war is retarded.its not like vhs vs. beta because beta sucked!blu-ray and hd-dvd both deliver crystal clear audio and video.they are an equal match.im starting to notice that alot of people are leaning more towards blu-ray.but hd-dvd is the more affordable player.and for the most part your average consumer isnt gonna spend 600.00 for a movie player.ps3 is the only reason blu-ray is where it is now.here is a solution one side of disc blu-ray the other side hd-dvd.
customer_reviews.author: DIMEDAMAGE

customer_reviews.title: Spare
customer_reviews.text: Used in spare bedroom for guest if they wish. Not much usage.
customer_reviews.author: boomer

customer_reviews.title: Don't get the Blu's
customer_reviews.text: It took me a long time to make a decision but I am TOTALLY happy that I chose HD-DVD over Blu-ray. My friend tried hard to get me to go with the Blu-ray and after seeing this product he is putting his $1000 dollar Sony on E-Bay. The HD-A2 loads fast, incredible picture, hastle free set up and operation.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Nardone

customer_reviews.title: Great HD DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how great the picture/sound quality is! I haven't even watched an HD DVD on it yet but the up conversion is great on regular DVDs! If SD DVDs look this great I can't wait to watch some HD DVDs on this!
customer_reviews.author: M. Toste

customer_reviews.title: Hate the thing
customer_reviews.text: The picture is outstanding, but lately it has been crashing on me. It will just stop at a random point. Brand new discs even stop and give me an error code; then, I have to go around back and unplug the player just to get the disc out. Going to return it and hope for the best, but from what I've read, other people are experiencing similar problems.
customer_reviews.author: K. Quick

customer_reviews.title: awesome player
customer_reviews.text: The sound and picture quality is fantastic.Nothing short of amazing.Plus I think it is as good or better than bluray. jac
customer_reviews.author: C. Carter

customer_reviews.title: SPECTACULAR player!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great player for the price and will give you an excellent hd picture and great sound as well. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: S. Blair

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: good, but could've gotten it for way cheaper elsewhere cuz HD wanna get their dvd players in everyones house hold.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua O. Tai

customer_reviews.title: HD A2 HD DVD
customer_reviews.text: A great player for the money. Be sure to get the latest firmware update
customer_reviews.author: William C. Snow

customer_reviews.title: Works Great... Too bad Toshiba Screwed Us
customer_reviews.text: Love the unit but it is worthless now. I would not be surprised to see a class action suit against Toshiba. I will not buy Toshiba products ever again.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.M in TN

customer_reviews.title: Great image, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: With HD DVD The picture is stunning. Period. But you have to be lucky if you don't have technical problems. You are enjoying a lot with the incredible picture, and suddenly the image freezing...Then you press stop and think "I'll fix in a minute". Don't. Then you try to turn off the player, but you can't!!!! The freezing continues on the screen. Then you have to unplugged from the AC connection!!!! Other problem: sometimes the image skip, like when you press fast forward. OTHER QUESTION: PEOPLE OF TOSHIBA, WHERE ARE MY HD DVD's from the Rebate? It's time to know something about it. My father and me send all the facts required almost one month ago.
customer_reviews.author: B. G. Erico

customer_reviews.title: No 24p
customer_reviews.text: The A2 and the A20 are the exact same players with slightly different firmware. The lack of firmware upgrade to 24p on the A2, makes this a no buy. 24p is extremely important if you have a large monitor or are using a front end projector. Without 24p, movements across the screen will judder (it is, the motion will not be smooth) when watching DVD movies. The A2/A20 player deliver excellent picture quality and no glitches. But pay the extra $50 for the A20 and get 24p (and straight 1080p) capability.
customer_reviews.author: hankaaron

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I finally sold my 360 add on to purchase the A-2. Wow is all I can say. In 1080i to my sony sxrd, the picture is truly amazing. It does take a bit before it fully loads up, but when it's ready your firing away. Take advantage of the sale, and get the 5 free movies. It's a great deal. It also upconverst dvd's which works great. The player comes with ethernet connection so you can easily download the latest upgrades. If your looking to go next gen, this bad boy is worth the money. I mean this is affordable at 299. I have the PS3 also for Bluray, and by far HD DVD outperforms. One happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lucero

product_meta.title: Toshiba HD-A2 HD DVD Player
product_meta.description:
Toshiba HD-A2 HD-DVD Player with HDMI output.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
High definition playback delivers 720p/1080i resolution at a transfer rate higher than DVD or even HDTV, resulting in a more detailed, realistic picture. Advanced audio, including Dolby® TrueHD, Dolby® Digital Plus and DTS® HD (core only), along with legacy formats including Dolby® Digital and DTS® bring an increased sonic realism to movie soundtracks. Backwards compatibility means you can enjoy your existing library of DVDs and CDs, and through the process of upconversion using HDMI, your movies are scaled to match the resolution of your HD display. An interface suite includes an abundance of audio/video connections as well as an ethernet connection for firmware updates and future internet delivered features. 

 

Key Video Features  * HD DVD playback (including Combo. Format Discs), DVD and DVD-R/-RW: High Definition video requires a tremendous amount of space on a disc, so a new Blue laser (versus a Red Laser for DVD) is utilized for HD DVD. The blue laser, with it’s shorter wave length, allows for information to be stored more densely on the disc, improving storage capacity by over 3 times that of a red laser technology. Additionally, more accurate and efficient video compression like MPEG-4 AVC and VC-1 (based on Microsoft’s Window Media) compress information to achieve file sizes that are less than half of the current standard DVD’s MPEG2. 
 * DVD upconversion via HDMI™ Video Upconversion - 720p/1080i: HDMI™ can support uncompressed digital video up to HDTV resolution. The HD-A2 player makes use of this conduit by up-converting the standard DVD picture resolution of 720p or 1080i. This makes a DVD player with an HDMI™ connection the perfect match for today's digital televisions. And because this conversion is performed in the player, the signal remains free frome excessive digital to analog artifacts. 
 * Video Output: 1080i/720p/480p/480i 

Key Audio Features  * Built-in Dolby® Digital, Dolby® TrueHD, Dolby® Digital Plus, DTS®, and DTS® HD (core only): The HD-A2 has built-in processors to handle the multi-channel decoders for Dolby Digital, Dolby Digital Plus, Dolby TrueHD , DTS and DTSHD. It employs the use of four DSPs to decode the multi-channel streams of the wide array of audio formats. These 32-bit floating-point DSPs are world renown for their high accuracy and are employed in many high quality audio solutions in the home theater market. 
 * Advanced high-performance 32-bit SHARC® Digital Signal Processing: Realize the benefits of new generation high-definition audio to complement high-definition video with 32-bit floating point SHARC DSP. Designed to perform audio conversion while executing extensive on-board multi-channel signal management, SHARC DSP in HD DVD delivers the stunning audio to complete your total high-definition experience. 
 * CD Audio Playback (CD, CD-R/-RW) 

 Conveniece Features: 

 * Slim design cabinetry 
 * New improved remote design with glow keys and TV operation 
 * Ethernet connection 
 * HDMI 1.2a interface, component video, S-Video, composite video 

 Connections: 

 * ColorStream Pro® Component Video Output: ColorStream Pro® progressive scan provides a non-interlaced component video DVD/TV connection that allows DVD-Video to reach its maximum picture quality potential. Every DVD-Video disc is mastered in MPEG-2 progressive scan (480P). By preserving DVD's progressive scan image, the ColorStream PRO connection provides a new dimension in total picture quality, delivering a more film-like, three-dimensional image. The progressive scan image is flicker-free, with virtually no visible NTSC line structure or motion artifacts, and offers better resolution than standard interlaced images. These outputs allow the video signal to be sent from the DVD player to a component video equipped interlaced or progressive scan TV. When this connection is utilized with today's HD-compatible sets, typical NTSC artifacts-like video noise, dot crawl, and flicker-are virtually eliminated, resulting in a low-noise, highly detailed picture with unequaled color purity. 
 * Composite Outputs -- 1 
 * S-Video Outputs -- 1 
 * Component Outputs -- 1 
 * HDMI Output Version 1.2 -- 1 
 *
feature_bullets: Up-Conversion for all Standard DVD Titles
